snippet: A petition on Change.org helped bring about the lender’s new rule on forbearance fees.
abstract: Sallie Mae, the nation's largest private student-loan provider, changes its fee policy in response to an online Change.org petition; for years, Sallie Mae had required unemployed people who could not afford their monthly payments to pay a $50-per-loan fee every three months to suspend their payments temporarily, even as interest charges mounted; forbearance fee will continue but will be applied to a customer's balance after they resume a track record of ontime payments.
lead_paragraph: A petition on Change.org helped bring about the lender’s new rule on forbearance fees.

headline.seo: Sallie Mae to Change Forbearance Fee Policy
headline.main: Online Campaign Prompts Sallie Mae to Change Fee Policy for Loan Suspensions
